conbody.p: You stack views by placing one view on top of another to create a new view.

A stacked view takes its regional settings by default from the upper view in the View pane. For example, if the upper view has dates in US format (mm/dd/yyyy), dates in the stacked view appear in mm/dd/yyyy format. You can change the regional settings of any view by selecting the view, then selecting ViewsLocaleRegional Settings.

A stacked view contains a column for each unique column in the original views. If the original views contain columns with the same name, the stacked view combines their data in a column with the same name. If a column does not appear in all the original views, its data appears blank in the rows corresponding to the views where the column did not exist.
